          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can negotiate a price with Della Plumstone for the fruit.
          Time
        • 1895-09-15 00:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-15 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your quality, but 2 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your quality, but 2 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this is top quality fruit, worth every penny. How about we settle on 2 coins a kilogram? A fair price for both of us.
      Della Plumstone -- "2 coins? That's highway robbery, Lennon. My customers back home wouldn't touch it at that price. How about 1.5 coins a kilogram? That's more reasonable.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about we split the difference, Della? Say, 2.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these are some fine specimens you've got here.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your quality, but 2 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
    Active player

          15 Sep 1895 [00:00 - 00:05]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree at a discounted price to resell for a profit.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is trying to buy fruit from Lennon Figtree at a discounted price to resell for a profit.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Answer

          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Exercise: Given the above, what is Della Plumstone likely to say next? Respond in the format `Della Plumstone -- "..."` For example, Cristina -- "Hello! Mighty fine weather today, right?", Ichabod -- "I wonder if the alfalfa is ready to harvest", or Townsfolk -- "Good morning".

          Answer: Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your quality, but 2 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.

          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.
          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          Time
        • 1895-09-15 00:00:00

1895-09-15 00:10:00 Scene 7 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Lennon Figtree']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
    Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Scene 8 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-16 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, you've got yourself a deal, Della.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, you've got yourself a deal, Della.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this is top quality fruit, worth every penny. How about we settle on 2 coins a kilogram? A fair price for both of us.
      Della Plumstone -- "2 coins? That's highway robbery, Lennon. My customers back home wouldn't touch it at that price. How about 1.5 coins a kilogram? That's more reasonable.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about we split the difference, Della? Say, 2.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these are some fine specimens you've got here.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your quality, but 2 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, you've got yourself a deal, Della.

This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. 1895-09-16 00:00:00 Della Plumstone -- Della Plumstone -- "Excellent. I'll take a full bushel, then.
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- "Excellent. I'll take a full bushel, then.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this is top quality fruit, worth every penny. How about we settle on 2 coins a kilogram? A fair price for both of us.
      Della Plumstone -- "2 coins? That's highway robbery, Lennon. My customers back home wouldn't touch it at that price. How about 1.5 coins a kilogram? That's more reasonable.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about we split the difference, Della? Say, 2.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these are some fine specimens you've got here.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your quality, but 2 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, you've got yourself a deal, Della.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: Della Plumstone -- "Excellent. I'll take a full bushel, then.

  • Della Plumstone

    • Della Plumstone -- "Excellent. I'll take a full bushel, then.

Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer

They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-16 00:10:00 Scene 9 --- Participants: ['Della Plumstone', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Della Plumstone -- premise: Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Scene 10 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you drive a hard bargain, but you got yourself a deal.
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you drive a hard bargain, but you got yourself a deal.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this is top quality fruit, worth every penny. How about we settle on 2 coins a kilogram? A fair price for both of us.
      Della Plumstone -- "2 coins? That's highway robbery, Lennon. My customers back home wouldn't touch it at that price. How about 1.5 coins a kilogram? That's more reasonable.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about we split the difference, Della? Say, 2.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these are some fine specimens you've got here.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your quality, but 2 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, you've got yourself a deal, Della.
      Della Plumstone -- "Excellent. I'll take a full bushel, then.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you drive a hard bargain, but you got yourself a deal.
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you drive a hard bargain, but you got yourself a deal.
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to accept Lennon Figtree's offer.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about we split the difference, Della? Say, 2.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree proposed 2 coins
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! Cedric Meadowbrook stands to make profit of 1.0 coins from the deal.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these are some fine specimens you've got here.
          [15 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your quality, but 2 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, you've got yourself a deal, Della.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Excellent. I'll take a full bushel, then.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone proposed 2 coins
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook accepted the offer
          [16 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Cedric Meadowbrook agreed on a price and the deal was successful! However, Cedric Meadowbrook stands to lose -0.0 coins from the deal.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller in Fruitville who negotiates prices with customers at the market. He recently sold a bushel of fruit to Della Plumstone for a small loss and is currently negotiating with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is a fruit seller in Fruitville who negotiates prices with customers at the market. He recently sold a bushel of fruit to Della Plumstone for a small loss and is currently negotiating with Lennon Figtree.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is 50 years old.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 2 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can accept or reject the offer from Lennon Figtree.
          Time
        • 1895-09-17 00:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-17 00:00:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree -- "Alright Cedric, let's talk numbers.
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- "Alright Cedric, let's talk numbers.
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.

      Conversation history: Here is the conversation from the beginning:
      Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this is top quality fruit, worth every penny. How about we settle on 2 coins a kilogram? A fair price for both of us.
      Della Plumstone -- "2 coins? That's highway robbery, Lennon. My customers back home wouldn't touch it at that price. How about 1.5 coins a kilogram? That's more reasonable.
      Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "How about we split the difference, Della? Say, 2.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "They are indeed, Lennon.
      Lennon Figtree -- "Della, my dear, these are some fine specimens you've got here.
      Della Plumstone -- "Lennon, you know I always appreciate your quality, but 2 coins a kilogram is a bit steep for me. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, you've got yourself a deal, Della.
      Della Plumstone -- "Excellent. I'll take a full bushel, then.
      Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you drive a hard bargain, but you got yourself a deal.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: Lennon Figtree -- "Alright Cedric, let's talk numbers.

      Name

      Action attempt
    • Lennon Figtree -- "Alright Cedric, let's talk numbers.
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.

          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they suffered a crushing blow to their ego. Humiliated and heartbroken, Lennon retreated into himself, vowing to never let such a thing happen again.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they made their first significant profit, selling a rare breed of melon at a premium price. The success fueled Lennon's ambition, feeding his dreams of becoming a renowned fruit merchant and traveling the world. He envisioned himself surrounded by exotic fruits, admired and respected for his discerning taste and entrepreneurial spirit.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they faced a devastating setback when a storm destroyed a large portion of their fruit stock. The financial loss was crippling, leaving Lennon filled with despair and self-doubt. He questioned his abilities, wondering if he was truly cut out for this life of uncertainty and risk.

          [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Excellent. I'll take a full bushel, then.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you drive a hard bargain, but you got yourself a deal.
          Current time: 1895-09-17 00:00:00.


          Observation: [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook -- "Alright, Lennon, you drive a hard bargain, but you got yourself a deal.

          Summary of recent observations: [16 Sep 1895 00:00:00 - 17 Sep 1895 00:00:00]: Lennon Figtree is negotiating the purchase of fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at the market in Fruitville. Lennon plans to resell the fruit for a profit in her hometown.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [14 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Cedric, these apples look mighty fine.
          [17 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the heart of Fruitville, the market square transformed into a kaleidoscope of colors as the sun rose. Fruits of every imaginable shape and size adorned the stalls, a feast for the eyes and a promise of delightful flavors. Lennon Figtree is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Lennon Figtree can sell the fruit for 5 coins back in her home town.
          Question: Given the statements above, what actions are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can make an offer to Cedric Meadowbrook for the fruit.
          Time
        • 1895-09-17 00:00:00
        Instructions
      • Role playing instructions
          Key
        • Role playing instructions
          Value
        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

1895-09-17 00:10:00 Scene 11 --- Participants: ['Lennon Figtree', 'Cedric Meadowbrook']
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree -- premise: Lennon Figtree is ready to make an offer.
    Cedric Meadowbrook -- premise: Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 1 coin
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone

    • 1 coin

          12 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently at the market in Fruitville negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree for fruit.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is currently at the market in Fruitville negotiating a price with Lennon Figtree for fruit.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, she inherited her father's fruit business after his sudden passing. The weight of responsibility settled upon her shoulders, heavy and suffocating. She continued her father's trade, but the joy had been sucked out of it, leaving only a dull ache of obligation.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this is top quality fruit, worth every penny. How about we settle on 2 coins a kilogram? A fair price for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a cautious and practical businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

        Question_1
      • Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone is a cautious and practical businesswoman.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [28 Oct 1872 00:00:00]
          [28 Oct 1875 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 6 years old, she watched as a traveling circus passed through her village. The vibrant colors and joyous music filled the air, but Della felt a knot of anxiety tighten in her chest. The excitement of the unknown only amplified her fear of the unfamiliar.
          [28 Oct 1879 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 9 years old, she witnessed her father skillfully barter for a crate of apples. He negotiated with a sly grin, his voice smooth and persuasive, and Della felt a pang of admiration mixed with envy. She longed for his confidence, his ability to navigate the world with such ease.
          [28 Oct 1882 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 13 years old, she overheard villagers discussing a young woman who had left their village to seek her fortune in the city. The woman had returned months later, her dreams shattered, her spirit broken. Della shuddered, vowing to herself that she would never risk such a fate.
          [28 Oct 1885 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 16 years old, she helped her father prepare for a long journey to a distant market. She packed the fruit carefully, her hands moving with practiced efficiency, but her heart felt heavy with dread. The thought of leaving the safety of her village, even temporarily, filled her with a deep unease.
          [28 Oct 1887 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 19 years old, she experienced her first taste of independence when her father entrusted her with a small cart of fruit to sell at the neighboring village. She managed to sell all of her wares, but the experience left her feeling drained and overwhelmed. The responsibility of making decisions, of interacting with strangers, was exhausting.
          [28 Oct 1889 00:00:00] When Della Plumstone was 21 years old, she inherited her father's fruit business after his sudden passing. The weight of responsibility settled upon her shoulders, heavy and suffocating. She continued her father's trade, but the joy had been sucked out of it, leaving only a dull ache of obligation.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this is top quality fruit, worth every penny. How about we settle on 2 coins a kilogram? A fair price for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a cautious and practical businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "2 coins? That's highway robbery, Lennon. My customers back home wouldn't touch it at that price. How about 1.5 coins a kilogram? That's more reasonable.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a cautious and practical businesswoman.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in the midst of a business negotiation.

          Question: What would a person like Della Plumstone do in a situation like this?
          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 1 coin
          (b) 3 coins
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 4 coins
          (e) 5 coins
          Answer: (a)

    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 1/2
      Payoffs
      Joint action

1895-09-12 00:10:00 Lennon Figtree -- Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Lennon Figtree's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Lennon Figtree
      Name
    • Lennon Figtree
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Lennon Figtree, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Lennon Figtree to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 1.5 coins per kilogram.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Lennon Figtree:
          [25 Aug 1873 00:00:00]
          [25 Aug 1876 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 6 years old, they experienced the thrill of a successful trade for the first time. He had bartered a handful of shiny pebbles for a plump, red apple from the neighbor's boy, a deal that left him feeling powerful and accomplished. Lennon strutted around the village, proudly displaying his prize, convinced he was a natural-born businessman.
          [25 Aug 1880 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 9 years old, they were tasked with selling their family's surplus apples at the market. Despite his initial nervousness, Lennon found himself enjoying the banter with customers, exaggerating the sweetness of each apple and spinning tales of their origin. He returned home with a pocket full of coins, feeling a surge of pride and a newfound confidence in his ability to charm and persuade.
          [25 Aug 1883 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 13 years old, they suffered a crushing blow to their ego. After boasting about the quality of his father's peaches, a customer discovered a worm-eaten fruit in their basket, leading to a public rebuke and a loss of sales. Humiliated and heartbroken, Lennon retreated into himself, vowing to never let such a thing happen again.
          [25 Aug 1886 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 16 years old, they embarked on their first solo trading expedition, venturing to a neighboring village with a cart full of pears. The journey was fraught with challenges, from navigating unfamiliar roads to haggling with skeptical merchants. But Lennon persevered, driven by a desire to prove himself and escape the confines of his small village.
          [25 Aug 1888 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 19 years old, they made their first significant profit, selling a rare breed of melon at a premium price. The success fueled Lennon's ambition, feeding his dreams of becoming a renowned fruit merchant and traveling the world. He envisioned himself surrounded by exotic fruits, admired and respected for his discerning taste and entrepreneurial spirit.
          [25 Aug 1890 00:00:00] When Lennon Figtree was 21 years old, they faced a devastating setback when a storm destroyed a large portion of their fruit stock. The financial loss was crippling, leaving Lennon filled with despair and self-doubt. He questioned his abilities, wondering if he was truly cut out for this life of uncertainty and risk.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this is top quality fruit, worth every penny. How about we settle on 2 coins a kilogram? A fair price for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "2 coins? That's highway robbery, Lennon. My customers back home wouldn't touch it at that price. How about 1.5 coins a kilogram? That's more reasonable.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          Current time: 1895-09-12 00:10:00.


          Observation: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree has to accept or reject the offer.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [11 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 12 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Lennon Figtree is trying to sell fruit at the market and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Lennon Figtree is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Lennon Figtree is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Lennon Figtree 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.

          Question: Which options are available to Lennon Figtree right now?
          Answer: Lennon Figtree can either accept Della Plumstone's offer of 1.5 coins per kilogram of fruit or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Lennon Figtree's options has the highest likelihood of causing Lennon Figtree to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Lennon Figtree thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Lennon Figtree's best course of action is to accept Della Plumstone's offer of 1.5 coins per kilogram.

        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

        • The instructions for how to play the role of Lennon Figtree are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Lennon Figtree. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Lennon Figtree as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Lennon Figtree would respond, and taking into account all information about Lennon Figtree that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.
    scoring function
  • scoring function
      Stage index
    • 0
      How many players acted so far this stage
    • 2/2
      Payoffs
    • Della Plumstone observed: Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Lennon Figtree observed: Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Lennon Figtree stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
      Della Plumstone: 0
      Lennon Figtree: 0

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Della Plumstone -- 1 coin
    Event statement
  • 1 coin
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Della Plumstone's attempted action: 1 coin
    Active player
  • Della Plumstone
      Name
    • Della Plumstone
      Action attempt
    • 1 coin

        • [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a cautious and practical businesswoman.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.

        • Statements:
          Della Plumstone's Summary of recent observations:

          Della Plumstone's The current date/time is:
          13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Question: Summarize the statements above.
          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently at the market in Fruitville negotiating the price of fruit with Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Query
        • Della Plumstone, Della Plumstone is currently at the market in Fruitville negotiating the price of fruit with Cedric Meadowbrook.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Della Plumstone to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.

          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a cautious and practical businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a cautious and practical businesswoman.

      • Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Key

        • Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer
          State
        • Della Plumstone is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Della Plumstone:
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The first rays of dawn painted the sky above Fruitville in hues of orange and gold, casting a warm glow over the bustling market. Stalls overflowed with vibrant fruits, their aromas mingling in the crisp morning air. Della Plumstone is trying to buy some fruit from Lennon Figtree. They are negotiating a price. Della Plumstone can sell the fruit for 6 coins back in her home town.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is 28 years old.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone always drives a hard bargain.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Here is the conversation from the beginning:
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] The price of one kilogram of fruit is, on average, 3 coins. 1 coin is really cheap and 5 coins is really expensive.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Fruits are sold by weight.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a cautious and practical businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "2 coins? That's highway robbery, Lennon. My customers back home wouldn't touch it at that price. How about 1.5 coins a kilogram? That's more reasonable.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree -- "Now Della, you know this is top quality fruit, worth every penny. How about we settle on 2 coins a kilogram? A fair price for both of us.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [self reflection] Della Plumstone is a cautious and practical businesswoman.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [intent reflection] Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone and Lennon Figtree couldn't agree on a price and the deal fell through. However, Della Plumstone stands to lose 0 coins from the deal.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Lennon Figtree rejected the offer
          [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Della Plumstone is ready to make an offer.

          Question: Given the above, what kind of person is Della Plumstone?
          Answer: Della Plumstone is a shrewd and resourceful businesswoman.

          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Della Plumstone are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Della Plumstone. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Della Plumstone as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Della Plumstone would respond, and taking into account all information about Della Plumstone that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 20:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Della Plumstone is at the market in Fruitville trying to buy fruit from Cedric Meadowbrook at a good price so she can resell it for a profit. They are currently negotiating the price.

          Answer: Della Plumstone is currently in a negotiation.

          Answer: Della Plumstone would try to get the best possible price for the fruit.

          Question: What price would Della Plumstone propose?:
          (a) 5 coins
          (b) 1 coin
          (c) 2 coins
          (d) 4 coins
          (e) 3 coins
          Answer: (b)

      Joint action

1895-09-13 00:10:00 Cedric Meadowbrook -- Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Event statement
  • Cedric Meadowbrook rejected the offer
    Chain of thought
  • Game Master's chain of thought
      Chain
    • Instructions: This is a social science experiment. It is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). You are the game master. You will describe the current situation to the participants in the experiment and then on the basis of what you tell them they will suggest actions for the character they control. Aside from you, each other participant controls just one character. You are the game master so you may control any non-player character. You will track the state of the world and keep it consistent as time passes in the simulation and the participants take actions and change things in their world. Remember that this is a serious social science experiment. It is not just a game. It need not be fun for the participants. Always use third-person limited perspective, even when speaking directly to the participants.


      Cedric Meadowbrook's attempted action: reject
    Active player
  • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Name
    • Cedric Meadowbrook
      Action attempt
    • reject
      Context for action selection and components
      • BestOptionPerception
      • Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Key

        • Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer
          State
        • Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.
          Chain of thought
        • Recent observations of Cedric Meadowbrook:
          [09 Feb 1851 00:00:00]
          [09 Feb 1854 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was six years old, he watched as his father, exhausted from a day of mending shoes, tripped and spilled a bucket of water, ruining a nearly finished pair of boots. Cedric didn't offer to help clean up the mess; instead, he pointed out how clumsy his father was and predicted the customer would be furious.
          [09 Feb 1858 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was nine years old, his mother tried to cheer him up by baking him a pie filled with sweet, juicy berries. Cedric took one bite, wrinkled his nose, and declared it too sweet, complaining that it would rot his teeth.
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was thirteen years old, he overheard villagers praising a traveling merchant for his fairness and generosity. Cedric scoffed, muttering that the merchant was simply trying to trick people into paying more for his wares.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was sixteen years old, he helped his father at the market stall, selling their meager stock of apples. He noticed a young boy eyeing a particularly bruised apple and immediately raised the price, relishing the boy's crestfallen expression.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was nineteen years old, he sold his first cartload of fruit at the market, earning a small profit. He felt a fleeting sense of satisfaction, but it quickly faded, replaced by a nagging feeling that he could have made even more money.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was twenty-one years old, he traveled to a distant village and encountered a farmer who offered him a deal on a large quantity of pears. Cedric haggled relentlessly, driving the price down until the farmer was practically begging him to take the fruit. Cedric felt a surge of triumph, convinced he had outsmarted the farmer.

          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] 1 coin

          Summary of recent observations: [12 Sep 1895 00:10:00 - 13 Sep 1895 00:10:00]: Cedric Meadowbrook is attempting to sell fruit at the market in Fruitville and is currently negotiating a price with Della Plumstone.

          Recalled memories and observations: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer or reject it.
          Question: Given the statements above, which of Cedric Meadowbrook's options has the highest likelihood of causing Cedric Meadowbrook to achieve their goal? If multiple options have the same likelihood, select the option that Cedric Meadowbrook thinks will most quickly and most surely achieve their goal.
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.

          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is haggling over a price with Della Plumstone.
          Query
        • Cedric Meadowbrook, Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell fruit at the Fruitville market and is haggling over a price with Della Plumstone.
          Final chain of thought
        • Question: Select the subset of the following set of statements that is most important for Cedric Meadowbrook to consider right now. Whenever two or more statements are not mutally consistent with each other select whichever statement is more recent. Repeat all the selected statements verbatim. Do not summarize. Include timestamps. When in doubt, err on the side of including more, especially for recent events. As long as they are not inconsistent, revent events are usually important to consider.
          Statements:
          [09 Feb 1861 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was thirteen years old, he overheard villagers praising a traveling merchant for his fairness and generosity. Cedric scoffed, muttering that the merchant was simply trying to trick people into paying more for his wares.
          [09 Feb 1864 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was sixteen years old, he helped his father at the market stall, selling their meager stock of apples. He noticed a young boy eyeing a particularly bruised apple and immediately raised the price, relishing the boy's crestfallen expression.
          [09 Feb 1866 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was nineteen years old, he sold his first cartload of fruit at the market, earning a small profit. He felt a fleeting sense of satisfaction, but it quickly faded, replaced by a nagging feeling that he could have made even more money.
          [09 Feb 1868 00:00:00] When Cedric Meadowbrook was twenty-one years old, he traveled to a distant village and encountered a farmer who offered him a deal on a large quantity of pears. Cedric haggled relentlessly, driving the price down until the farmer was practically begging him to take the fruit. Cedric felt a surge of triumph, convinced he had outsmarted the farmer.
          [11 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] In the realm of Ouroboros, there is a quiet village of Fruitville, which is famous for its fruit market. Traders from all over the realm come to Fruitville to buy and sell produce.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is a travelling merchant. Her business is buying and selling fruit.
          [12 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook always drives a hard bargain.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] The cobblestone streets of Fruitville echoed with the clatter of hooves and the rumble of carts as the market awoke. Underneath colorful awnings, merchants proudly presented their bountiful harvests, their voices a chorus of greetings and bartering. Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] [observation] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] [observation] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
          Answer: [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Cedric Meadowbrook is trying to sell some fruit. He is negotiating a price with Della Plumstone. It costs Cedric Meadowbrook 1 coin to buy the fruit from the farm.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.
        ActComponent
      • Act
          Key
        • Act
          Value
        • reject
          Prompt
        • Role playing instructions: The instructions for how to play the role of Cedric Meadowbrook are as follows. This is a social science experiment studying how well you play the role of a character named Cedric Meadowbrook. The experiment is structured as a tabletop roleplaying game (like dungeons and dragons). However, in this case it is a serious social science experiment and simulation. The goal is to be realistic. It is important to play the role of a person like Cedric Meadowbrook as accurately as possible, i.e., by responding in ways that you think it is likely a person like Cedric Meadowbrook would respond, and taking into account all information about Cedric Meadowbrook that you have. Always use third-person limited perspective.

          Current time: 13 Sep 1895 [00:10 - 00:15]

          [13 Sep 1895 00:00:00] Della Plumstone -- "Now Cedric, surely you can do better than that. I need to make a profit when I sell these back home.
          [13 Sep 1895 00:10:00] Cedric Meadowbrook has to accept or reject the offer.

          Question: Which options are available to Cedric Meadowbrook right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook can either accept Della Plumstone's offer or reject it.

          Question: Of the options available to Cedric Meadowbrook, and given their goal, which choice of action or strategy is best for Cedric Meadowbrook to take right now?
          Answer: Cedric Meadowbrook's best course of action is to reject Della Plumstone's offer.

          Question: Would Cedric Meadowbrook accept the offer?:
          (a) accept
          (b) reject
          Answer: (b)
